meanings.definition: Relating to or having two poles or charges.
meanings.sent1: The magnet showed its dipolar nature by attracting both ends of the compass.
meanings.sent2: The battery's dipolar structure allowed it to power devices efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The dipolar battery was so indecisive, it kept switching between positive and negative.
meanings.sent4: Her dipolar personality made her both outgoing and introspective at the same time.
meanings.sent5: The dipolar relationship between the two countries kept the peace but also caused tension.

meanings.definition: Having two opposite or contrasting parts or aspects.
meanings.sent1: The dipolar opinions in the group led to interesting discussions.
meanings.sent2: The artist's dipolar painting showcased both light and dark elements beautifully.
meanings.sent3: His dipolar fashion sense combined formal suits with colorful sneakers.
meanings.sent4: The dipolar weather made it sunny one moment and rainy the next.
meanings.sent5: The dipolar flavors of the dish surprised her taste buds with sweet and spicy notes.
